name: a
summary: The `<a>` HTML element (or anchor element), with its `href` attribute, creates a hyperlink to web pages, files, email addresses, locations in the same page, or anything else a URL can address.
contentCategories: Flow content, phrasing content, interactive content, palpable content.
permittedContent: Transparent, except that no descendant may be interactive content or an a element, and no descendant may have a specified tabindex attribute.
permittedParents: Any element that accepts phrasing content, or any element that accepts flow content, but not other `<a>` elements.
implicitAriaRole: link when href attribute is present, otherwise no corresponding role
permittedAriaRoles: When href attribute is present: button checkbox menuitem menuitemcheckbox menuitemradio option radio switch tab treeitem When href attribute is not present: any

download.name: download
download.summary: Causes the browser to treat the linked URL as a download. Can be used with or without a value.

href.name: href
href.summary: The URL that the hyperlink points to. Links are not restricted to HTTP-based URLs â€” they can use any URL scheme supported by browsers.

hreflang.name: hreflang
hreflang.summary: Hints at the human language of the linked URL. No built-in functionality. Allowed values are the same as the global `lang` attribute.

ping.name: ping
ping.summary: A space-separated list of URLs. When the link is followed, the browser will send POST requests with the body `PING` to the URLs. Typically for tracking.

referrerpolicy.name: referrerpolicy
referrerpolicy.summary: How much of the referrer to send when following the link.

rel.name: rel
rel.summary: The relationship of the linked URL as space-separated link types.

target.name: target
target.summary: Where to display the linked URL, as the name for a browsing context (a tab, window, or iframe). The following keywords have special meanings for where to load the URL.

type.name: type
type.summary: Hints at the linked URL's format with a MIME type. No built-in functionality.
